info.name: EveryTriv API Collection
info.description:
ðŸŽ¯ **COMPLETE API COLLECTION FOR EVERYTRIV TRIVIA PLATFORM**

**Platform Overview:**
EveryTriv is a comprehensive trivia game platform featuring AI-powered question generation, real-time multiplayer capabilities, advanced analytics, and a complete user management system.

**Key Features:**
- ðŸ¤– **AI-Powered Questions:** Groq AI provider with multiple models (Llama, GPT-OSS, Mixtral, Gemma)
- ðŸŽ® **Multiple Game Modes:** Classic, Time Attack, Custom Difficulty
- ðŸ† **Leaderboards:** Global, weekly, monthly rankings
- ðŸ’° **Credits System:** Earn and spend credits for gameplay
- ðŸ“Š **Advanced Analytics:** User performance, game statistics, system metrics
- ðŸ” **Complete Auth:** JWT-based authentication with role management
- ðŸ’³ **Payment Integration:** Stripe integration for premium features

**Authentication:**
- Most endpoints require JWT token in Authorization header
- Admin endpoints require 'admin' role
- Public endpoints marked with @Public() decorator

**Rate Limiting:**
- Login: 5 attempts per minute
- Registration: 3 attempts per 5 minutes
- Game actions: 20 per minute
- Admin actions: 5 per minute

**Base URL:** http://localhost:3001 (development)
**API Version:** v1
**Documentation:** See /docs for Swagger documentation

// Adds randomness to delays to prevent thundering herd problem
const percentageJitter = delay * Math.max(0, Math.min(1, percentage));
// Check if request needs admin token (has {{adminAccessToken}} in headers)
// Replace {{adminAccessToken}} and {{userAccessToken}} in headers if tokens exist (do this early)
needsAdminToken = true; // Mark as needing admin token
// Inject Authorization header automatically when token exists and admin token not requested
// Handle admin token requests (either via X-Use-Admin-Token header or {{adminAccessToken}} in Authorization)
const responseData = loginBody && loginBody.data ? loginBody.data : loginBody;
const newAccessToken = responseData && responseData.access_token ? responseData.access_token : loginBody.access_token;
const newRefreshToken = responseData && responseData.refresh_token ? responseData.refresh_token : loginBody.refresh_token;
console.warn('Failed to process admin login response', parseError);
console.warn('Admin auto-login failed', { error, status: response && response.code });
// Ensure userId is set from registeredUserId if not available
// Replace placeholder segments in URL when relevant values are available
// Replace {{userId}} in URL - Postman variables need explicit replacement in prerequest
// For admin endpoints without userId, use placeholder
// Add delay between requests to avoid rate limiting (429 errors)
// Note: Postman doesn't support synchronous delays, so we track last request time
// and rely on Newman/Postman runner's iteration delay or test script handling
// Apply jitter to base delay to prevent synchronized requests
const jitter = calculateJitter(baseDelayMs, { percentage: 0.05, maxJitter: 50 }); // 5% jitter, max 50ms for base delay
// Helper functions for shared collection variables
// Calculate jitter value for retry delays (mirrors calculateJitter from shared/utils/core/retry.utils.ts)
// Adds randomness to retry delays to prevent thundering herd problem
const percentageJitter = delay * Math.max(0, Math.min(1, percentage));
// Handle 429 Rate Limit errors - adjust delay automatically
// If server provided retryAfter, use it to calculate new delay
// Convert retryAfter (seconds) to milliseconds and add some buffer
// Add jitter to prevent thundering herd (10% of delay, max 1000ms)
console.log(`Rate limited! Adjusted request delay to ${suggestedDelay}ms (base: ${baseDelay}ms, jitter: ${Math.round(jitter)}ms, retryAfter: ${retryAfter}s)`);
// Add jitter to prevent synchronized retries (10% of delay, max 1000ms)
console.log(`Rate limited! Increased request delay to ${newDelay}ms (base: ${baseDelay}ms, jitter: ${Math.round(jitter)}ms)`);
// Log rate limit headers if available
// If parsing fails, just increase delay with jitter
// Add jitter to prevent synchronized retries
console.log(`Rate limited! Increased request delay to ${newDelay}ms (base: ${baseDelay}ms, jitter: ${Math.round(jitter)}ms, parsing error occurred)`);
// On success, gradually reduce delay (if it was increased due to rate limiting)
// Gradually reduce back to minimum (100ms) but not too fast

item.name: ðŸ  App & Health
item.description:
ðŸ  **APPLICATION HEALTH & BASIC ENDPOINTS**

**Purpose:** Monitor application health, get basic information, and verify system status

**Authentication Requirements:**
- ðŸ”“ **Public Endpoints:** All health and info endpoints

**Key Features:**
- Application health monitoring
- System information retrieval
- Basic connectivity testing
- Service status verification
- Database health checks
- System metrics monitoring

**Available Endpoints:**
- Health Check (GET) - Detailed health check with database and system metrics
- Health Liveness (GET) - Lightweight liveness check for container orchestration
- Health Readiness (GET) - Readiness check with database connectivity
- App Info (GET) - Basic application information

**Use Cases:**
- System monitoring
- Health checks for Docker/Kubernetes
- Load balancer health checks
- Basic connectivity testing
- Service verification

item.name: ðŸ” Authentication
item.description:
ðŸ” **AUTHENTICATION & AUTHORIZATION ENDPOINTS**

**Purpose:** Handle user authentication, authorization, and session management

**Authentication Requirements:**
- ðŸ”“ **Public Endpoints:** Registration, login, refresh, OAuth
- ðŸ” **Protected Endpoints:** Current user, logout

**Key Features:**
- JWT-based authentication
- OAuth integration (Google)
- Role-based access control
- Session management
- Token refresh mechanism

**Available Endpoints:**
- Register User (POST)
- Login User (POST)
- Login Admin (POST)
- Refresh Token (POST)
- Get Current User (GET)
- Logout (POST)
- Google OAuth Login (GET)
- Google OAuth Callback (GET)

**Security Features:**
- Rate limiting on sensitive endpoints
- Password hashing and validation
- JWT token expiration
- Role-based permissions
- OAuth 2.0 integration

**Note:** Admin endpoints (statistics, trivia management) have been moved to /admin/* - see Admin Management section

item.name: ðŸ‘¨â€ðŸ‘©â€ðŸ‘¦â€ðŸ‘¦ Multiplayer (WebSocket)
item.description:
ðŸ‘¨â€ðŸ‘©â€ðŸ‘¦â€ðŸ‘¦ **MULTIPLAYER WEBSOCKET EVENTS** - Real-Time Simultaneous Trivia Games (Two Players)

**Purpose:** Handle real-time multiplayer simultaneous trivia games via WebSocket connections for exactly 2 players

**Connection:**
- WebSocket URL: `ws://localhost:3001/multiplayer` (or `wss://` for HTTPS)
- Authentication: JWT token required in connection handshake
  - Via `auth.token` in connection options
  - Via `query.token` in connection URL
  - Via `Authorization: Bearer <token>` header

**Authentication Requirements:**
- ðŸ” **All Events:** Require JWT authentication via WebSocket handshake

**Key Features:**
- Real-time simultaneous gameplay
- Room-based game sessions (exactly 2 players)
- Manual room creation with join codes
- Live leaderboard updates
- Question timer synchronization
- Answer submission and scoring
- Game state synchronization

**Available WebSocket Events:**

**Client â†’ Server Events:**
- `create-room` - Create a new multiplayer room
- `join-room` - Join an existing room
- `leave-room` - Leave current room
- `start-game` - Start the game (host only)
- `submit-answer` - Submit answer to current question

**Server â†’ Client Events:**
- `room-created` - Room successfully created
- `room-joined` - Successfully joined a room
- `room-left` - Successfully left a room
- `player-joined` - Another player joined the room
- `player-left` - A player left the room
- `game-started` - Game has started
- `question-started` - New question has started
- `answer-received` - Answer was received (confirmation)
- `question-ended` - Current question has ended
- `game-ended` - Game has finished
- `leaderboard-update` - Leaderboard updated
- `room-updated` - Room state updated
- `error` - Error occurred

**Connection Example (Socket.IO Client):**
```javascript
const socket = io('ws://localhost:3001/multiplayer', {
  auth: { token: 'YOUR_JWT_TOKEN' },
  query: { token: 'YOUR_JWT_TOKEN' },
  transports: ['websocket']
});
```

**Event Flow (Two Players):**
1. Player 1 connects to WebSocket with JWT token
2. Player 1 creates a room
3. Player 2 connects to WebSocket with JWT token
4. Player 2 joins the room created by Player 1
5. Player 1 starts the game (requires exactly 2 players)
6. Questions are sent to both players simultaneously
7. Both players submit answers
8. Results and leaderboard updates are broadcast
9. Game ends when all questions are answered
10. Both players leave the room

**Room Configuration:**
- Topic: Trivia topic (e.g., "Science", "History")
- Difficulty: Standard (easy/medium/hard) or custom
- Question Count: 1-50 questions
- Max Players: 2 players (fixed)
- Game Mode: question-limited, time-limited, or unlimited
- Time Per Question: Fixed 30 seconds for simultaneous games

request.description:
WebSocket endpoint: ws://localhost:3001/multiplayer

**Connection Requirements:**
- Protocol: WebSocket (ws:// or wss://)
- Namespace: /multiplayer
- Authentication: JWT token required

**Connection Options:**
```javascript
{
  auth: { token: 'YOUR_JWT_TOKEN' },
  query: { token: 'YOUR_JWT_TOKEN' },
  transports: ['websocket']
}
```

**Testing Note:**
- WebSocket events require a real WebSocket client (not HTTP requests)
- Use Socket.IO client library or WebSocket testing tools
- Postman supports WebSocket testing in newer versions
- For manual testing, use browser console or dedicated WebSocket clients

request.description:
**REST Proxy:** `POST /multiplayer/rooms`

Creates a new multiplayer room using user token

**WebSocket Event Mirrored:** `create-room`

**Emit (Socket.IO):** `socket.emit('create-room', { topic, difficulty, questionsPerRequest, maxPlayers, gameMode })`

**HTTP Response:** `{ room, code }`

**WebSocket Response Events:**
- `room-created` - Returns { room, code }
- `player-joined` - Broadcast to all players
- `error` - If creation fails

**Room Code:** Short 6-character code for easy sharing (first 6 chars of room ID)

request.description:
**REST Proxy:** `POST /multiplayer/rooms/join`

Joins an existing room using user token

**WebSocket Event Mirrored:** `join-room`

**HTTP Response:** `{ room }`

**WebSocket Response Events:**
- `room-joined` - Returns { room }
- `player-joined` - Broadcast to all players in room
- `error` - If join fails (room full, not found, etc.)

request.description:
**REST Proxy:** `POST /multiplayer/rooms/start`

Starts the game using user token (host only)

**WebSocket Event Mirrored:** `start-game`

**Emit:** `socket.emit('start-game', { roomId })`

**Requirements:**
- User must be the room host
- Exactly 2 players required
- Room status must be 'waiting'

**HTTP Response:** `{ room }`

**WebSocket Response Events:**
- `game-started` - Broadcast to both players with { questions, config }
- `question-started` - First question starts automatically
- `error` - If start fails (not host, not exactly 2 players, etc.)

request.description:
**REST Proxy:** `POST /multiplayer/rooms/answer`

Submits answer using user token

**WebSocket Event Mirrored:** `submit-answer`

**Emit:** `socket.emit('submit-answer', { roomId, questionId, answer, timeSpent })`

**Parameters:**
- `roomId`: Room UUID
- `questionId`: Question UUID
- `answer`: Answer index (0-3)
- `timeSpent`: Time spent in seconds

**HTTP Response:** `{ roomId, questionId, isCorrect, scoreEarned, leaderboard }`

**WebSocket Response Events:**
- `answer-received` - Confirmation with { userId, questionId, isCorrect, scoreEarned, leaderboard }
- `leaderboard-update` - Leaderboard updated
- `error` - If submission fails

**REST Proxy:** `POST /multiplayer/rooms/answer`

Submits answer using user token (second player)

**WebSocket Event Mirrored:** `submit-answer`

**Emit:** `socket.emit('submit-answer', { roomId, questionId, answer, timeSpent })`

**Parameters:**
- `roomId`: Room UUID
- `questionId`: Question UUID
- `answer`: Answer index (0-3)
- `timeSpent`: Time spent in seconds

**HTTP Response:** `{ roomId, questionId, isCorrect, scoreEarned, leaderboard }`

**WebSocket Response Events:**
- `answer-received` - Confirmation with { userId, questionId, isCorrect, scoreEarned, leaderboard }
- `leaderboard-update` - Leaderboard updated
- `error` - If submission fails
Returns the full multiplayer room document (`{ room }`) while both players are connected.
Returns `{ room, gameState }` prior to disconnecting players so diagnostics stay valid.

**REST Proxy:** `POST /multiplayer/rooms/leave`

Leaves the room using user token (host/admin)

**WebSocket Event Mirrored:** `leave-room`

**HTTP Response:** `{ roomId, status, remainingPlayers }`

**WebSocket Response Events:**
- `room-left` - Returns { roomId }
- `player-left` - Broadcast to remaining players
- `error` - If leave fails

**REST Proxy:** `POST /multiplayer/rooms/leave`

Leaves the room using user token (second player)

**WebSocket Event Mirrored:** `leave-room`

**HTTP Response:** `{ roomId, status, remainingPlayers }`

**WebSocket Response Events:**
- `room-left` - Returns { roomId }
- `player-left` - Broadcast to remaining players
- `error` - If leave fails
